text.p: Italian bonds and Btp futures surged in pre-holiday trade, ending just off session highs on a wave of shortcovering. Markets are closed Thursday for May Day.
There was some market of a possible imminent Bank of Italy discount rate cut although many dealers dismissed the rumours.

The market ignored earlier losses in U.S. Treasuries on bigger than forecast first quarter U.S. GDP jump although some said the data renewed fears of a Fed rate hike next month. The lira firmed against the mark below its 990 EMS central parity.
Some traders, however, said the Btp future looked overbought and would have trouble getting past strong resistance at 127.84.
